page.title: 05Penrhyn Castle
page.content: The splendid views from the castle make it easy to understand why buildings have occupied this site for hundreds of years. Beaumaris and the south-east corner of Anglesey with Puffin Island lie to the north. To the east the North Wales coast stretches to the Great Orme and Llandudno. To the south rises the mass of Snowdonia,while to the west Scotch Pines line the ridge of Bangor Mountain.Trees have been planted in the castle grounds by several distinguished visitors,in particular,a Californian Big Tree planted in 1889, near the car park. The gardens also contain large evergreens,fine Beeches and Holm Oak. From the Ice Tower leads a path to the walled gardens which contains many types of flowers.
